title: Man City vs Aston Villa LIVE: Stream, score, goals and latest Premier League updates
text:
Follow live updates as Premier League champions Manchester City welcome Aston Villa to the Etihad.

Pep Guardiola’s side recovered from their surprise defeat to Wolves with a routine victory over Crystal Palace and a midweek thrashing of Atalanta in the Champions League as Raheem Sterling scored a hat-trick. However, they still trail league leaders Liverpool by six points heading into the weekend.

Newly promoted Villa have started to see their wave of new signings gel, thrashing Norwich and edging Brighton, and could creep into the top half of the table with a win.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Man City vs Aston Villa Man City vs Aston Villa kicks off at 12:30pm

Man City XI: Ederson, Cancelo, Fernandinho, Stones, Mendy, Gündogan, Silva, De Bruyne, Bernardo, Sterling, Jesus.

Aston Villa XI: Heaton, Guilbert, Engels, Mings, Targett, Luiz, Nakamba, Grealish, McGinn, Trezeguet, Wesley.

Manchester City have been hit with more than a few injuries this season, Rodri and Oleksandr Zinchenko are the latest to suffer injury setbacks. How does this affect Guardiola's plans for the January transfer window? Pep Guardiola reveals how injuries affect City’s January transfer plans Last night Leicester travelled south and equalled a Premier League record. They dispatched Southampton 9-0 equalling the biggest winning margin in the Premier Leagueset by Manchester United against Ipswich, a long time ago. Here's how they did it: Leicester equal Premier League record win with thrashing of Southampton Raheem Sterling comes into the game off the back of his first Champions League hat-trick in midweek. Pep Guardiola stressed that Sterling's desire to be better is what is driving his current blistering form in front of goal, he said: "I didn't help anything. All the credit is for him. "Always we dream of players getting better. [Sterling] has this willing[ness] to do it, so it is possible." Manchester City have never lost two consecutive home Premier League games under Pep Guardiola, indeed Pep Guardiola has never lost consecutive home games in his managerial career. City have won nine successive Premier League games against Aston Villa, their last defeat to the midlands side coming in April 2007. If they defeat Villa today, Man City would equal their longest top flight winning streak against a single opponent. On the same side of the coin, Aston Villa would match their club record of consecutive away defeats to the same team in the top flight. Advertisement Leicester demolished Southampton 9-0 last night and moved up to second in the Premier League table. Man City have the chance to regain that spot with a win today over Aston Villa. Team news Manchester City make five changes to side that defeated Atalanta on Tuesday night. John Stones comes back for his first start since September with Joao Cancelo replacing Kyle Walker at right-back. Gabriel Jesus starts instead of Sergio Aguero with Bernardo Silva and David Silva all returning as well. Fernandinho again starts at centre-back. Aston Villa boss Dean Smith makes two changes to the side which beat Brighton last weekend, as Douglas Luiz and Trezeguet come in. They replace Conor Hourihane and Anwar El Ghazi, who are both on the bench. When is it?

Kick-off at the Etihad is at 12.30pm BST on Saturday 25 October.

How can I watch it?

The game will be aired live on BT Sport 1, with coverage beginning at midday. Subscribers to BT Sport can watch the game via the app or the online player.

Highlights will air on Match of the Day, which begins at 10.20pm on BBC One.

Team News

Man City are without Rodri, who picked up a hamstring injury during Champions League action in midweek. John Stones has come into the side to replace him.

Villa are able to call upon the services of defender James Chester for the first time this season. Jota is their only first-team absentee,
